rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The specific biochemical interaction through which this drug or supplement produces its pharmacological effect.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: mechanismOfAction

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Related anatomical structure(s) that are not part of the system but relate or connect to it, such as vascular bundles associated with an organ system.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: relatedStructure

schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:label: SingleBlindedTrial
schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:comment: A trial design in which the researcher knows which treatment the patient was randomly assigned to but the patient does not.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The expected progression of the condition if it is not treated and allowed to progress naturally.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: naturalProgression
epidemiology
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The characteristics of associated patients, such as age, gender, race etc.

schema:MedicalDevicePurpose.rdfs:label: Diagnostic
schema:MedicalDevicePurpose.rdfs:comment: A medical device used for diagnostic purposes.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: physiologicalBenefits
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Specific physiologic benefits associated to the plan.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: background
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Descriptive information establishing a historical perspective on the supplement. May include the rationale for the name, the population where the supplement first came to prominence, etc.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: SpeechPathology
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: The scientific study and treatment of defects, disorders, and malfunctions of speech and voice, as stuttering, lisping, or lalling, and of language disturbances, as aphasia or delayed language acquisition.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to this drug's use during pregnancy.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: pregnancyWarning

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: PalliativeProcedure

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: sensoryUnit
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The neurological pathway extension that inputs and sends information to the brain or spinal cord.
The medical conditions, treatments, etc. that are the subject of the guideline.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: guidelineSubject

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: People or organizations that endorse the plan.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: endorsers

schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:label: Homeopathic
schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:comment: A system of medicine based on the principle that a disease can be cured by a substance that produces similar symptoms in healthy people.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any characteristics of the population used in the study, e.g. 'males under 65'.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: population
nonProprietaryName
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The generic name of this drug or supplement.
Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to consumption of specific foods while taking this drug.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: foodWarning

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The neurological pathway that originates the neurons.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: sourcedFrom

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: How often one should break from the activity.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: restPeriods
infectiousAgentClass
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The class of infectious agent (bacteria, prion, etc.) that causes the disease.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: distinguishingSign
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: One of a set of signs and symptoms that can be used to distinguish this diagnosis from others in the differential diagnosis.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: drug
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Specifying a drug or medicine used in a medication procedure

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: associatedPathophysiology
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: If applicable, a description of the pathophysiology associated with the anatomical system, including potential abnormal changes in the mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions of the system.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that deals with the study and treatment of rheumatic, autoimmune or joint diseases.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Rheumatologic

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: exerciseType
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Type(s) of exercise or activity, such as strength training, flexibility training, aerobics, cardiac rehabilitation, etc.
A medical study or trial related to this entity.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: study

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that specializes in the care of infants, children and adolescents.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Pediatric

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: RadiationTherapy
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A process of care using radiation aimed at improving a health condition.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: legalStatus
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The drug or supplement's legal status, including any controlled substance schedules that apply.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the study of the kidneys and its respective disease states.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Renal

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: typicalTest
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A medical test typically performed given this condition.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: The therapy that is concerned with the maintenance or improvement of respiratory function (as in patients with pulmonary disease).
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: RespiratoryTherapy

schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:label: Chiropractic
schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:comment: A system of medicine focused on the relationship between the body's structure, mainly the spine, and its functioning.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to this drug's use by breastfeeding mothers.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: breastfeedingWarning

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: ReportedDoseSchedule
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A patient-reported or observed dosing schedule for a drug or supplement.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: relatedTherapy
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A medical therapy related to this anatomy.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Pathology
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the study of the cause, origin and nature of a disease state, including its consequences as a result of manifestation of the disease. In clinical care, the term is used to designate a branch of medicine using laboratory tests to diagnose and determine the prognostic significance of illness.

schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:label: Ear
schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:comment: Ear function assessment with clinical examination.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: DietNutrition
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: Dietetic and nutrition as a medical speciality.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Strength of evidence of the data used to formulate the guideline (enumerated).
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: evidenceLevel

schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:label: Protozoa
schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:comment: Single-celled organism that causes an infection.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Dermatologic
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: Something relating to or practicing dermatology
A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of skin.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Dermatology

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Expected or actual outcomes of the study.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: outcome

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A hospital with which the physician or office is affiliated.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: hospitalAffiliation
overview
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Descriptive information establishing the overarching theory/philosophy of the plan. May include the rationale for the name, the population where the plan first came to prominence, etc.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Anesthesia
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to study of anesthetics and their application.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: codeValue
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The actual code.
The currency (in 3-letter of the drug cost. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: costCurrency
codingSystem
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The coding system, e.g. 'ICD-10'.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: PreventionIndication
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An indication for preventing an underlying condition, symptom, etc.

schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:label: Prion
schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:comment: A prion is an infectious agent composed of protein in a misfolded form.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: postOp
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A description of the postoperative procedures, care, and/or followups for this device.
A dosage form in which this drug/supplement is available, e.g. 'tablet', 'suspension', 'injection'.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: dosageForm
diagnosis
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: One or more alternative conditions considered in the differential diagnosis process as output of a diagnosis process.

schema:DrugCostCategory.rdfs:label: Wholesale
schema:DrugCostCategory.rdfs:comment: The drug's cost represents the wholesale acquisition cost of the drug.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: True if the drug is available in a generic form (regardless of name).
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: isAvailableGenerically
studyDesign
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Specifics about the observational study design (enumerated).

A possible complication and/or side effect of this therapy. If it is known that an adverse outcome is serious (resulting in death, disability, or permanent damage; requiring hospitalization; or is otherwise life-threatening or requires immediate medical attention), tag it as a seriouseAdverseOutcome instead.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: adverseOutcome
bodyLocation
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Location in the body of the anatomical structure.
Date on which this guideline's recommendation was made.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: guidelineDate
insertion
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The place of attachment of a muscle, or what the muscle moves.

schema:MedicalStudyStatus.rdfs:label: ActiveNotRecruiting
schema:MedicalStudyStatus.rdfs:comment: Active, but not recruiting new participants.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: algorithm
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The algorithm or rules to follow to compute the score.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A medical test performed on a sample of a patient's blood.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: BloodTest

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The place or point where a muscle arises.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: origin

schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:comment: Pathogenic virus that causes viral infection.
schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:label: Virus

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this activity or condition.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: pathophysiology

schema:DrugCostCategory.rdfs:label: ReimbursementCap
schema:DrugCostCategory.rdfs:comment: The drug's cost represents the maximum reimbursement paid by an insurer for the drug.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: The medical care by a physician, or other health-care professional, who is the patient's first contact with the health-care system and who may recommend a specialist if necessary.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: PrimaryCare

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Bone
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Rigid connective tissue that comprises up the skeletal structure of the human body.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: True if this item's name is a proprietary/brand name (vs. generic name).
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: isProprietary

schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:label: FDAcategoryD
schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:comment: A designation by the US FDA signifying that there is positive evidence of human fetal risk based on adverse reaction data from investigational or marketing experience or studies in humans, but potential benefits may warrant use of the drug in pregnant women despite potential risks.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: VeterinaryCare
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A vet's office.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: drainsTo
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The vasculature that the vein drains into.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: applicableLocation
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The location in which the status applies.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A treatment of people with physical, emotional, or social problems, using purposeful activity to help them overcome or learn to deal with their problems.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: OccupationalTherapy

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: nerveMotor
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The neurological pathway extension that involves muscle control.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: identifyingTest
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A diagnostic test that can identify this sign.

schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:label: AnaerobicActivity
schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:comment: Physical activity that is of high-intensity which utilizes the anaerobic metabolism of the body.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: recommendationStrength
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Strength of the guideline's recommendation (e.g. 'class I').
A contraindication for this therapy.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: contraindication

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: An active ingredient, typically chemical compounds and/or biologic substances.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: activeIngredient

schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:comment: A trial that takes place at a single center.
schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:label: SingleCenterTrial

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: prescriptionStatus
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Indicates the status of drug prescription eg. local catalogs classifications or whether the drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter, etc.
The name given to how bone physically connects to each other.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: structuralClass

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Neurologic
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that studies the nerves and nervous system and its respective disease states.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: biomechnicalClass
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The biomechanical properties of the bone.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: secondaryPrevention
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A preventative therapy used to prevent reoccurrence of the medical condition after an initial episode of the condition.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A nurse-like health profession that deals with pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period (including care of the newborn), besides sexual and reproductive health of women throughout their lives.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Midwifery

schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:label: FDAcategoryC
schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:comment: A designation by the US FDA signifying that animal reproduction studies have shown an adverse effect on the fetus and there are no adequate and well-controlled studies in humans, but potential benefits may warrant use of the drug in pregnant women despite potential risks.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Gynecologic
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the health care of women, particularly in the diagnosis and treatment of disorders affecting the female reproductive system.

schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:label: StrengthTraining
schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:comment: Physical activity that is engaged in to improve muscle and bone strength. Also referred to as resistance training.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Cost per unit of the drug, as reported by the source being tagged.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: cost

schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:comment: A trial design in which neither the researcher nor the patient knows the details of the treatment the patient was randomly assigned to.
schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:label: DoubleBlindedTrial

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The condition, complication, etc. influenced by this factor.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: increasesRiskOf

schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:comment: Any physical activity engaged in for job-related purposes. Examples may include waiting tables, maid service, carrying a mailbag, picking fruits or vegetables, construction work, etc.
schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:label: OccupationalActivity

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: relatedAnatomy
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Anatomical systems or structures that relate to the superficial anatomy.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: associatedAnatomy
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The anatomy of the underlying organ system or structures associated with this entity.
The condition, complication, or symptom whose risk is being estimated.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: estimatesRiskOf
howPerformed
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: How the procedure is performed.
Drugs that affect the test's results.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: affectedBy
availableIn
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The location in which the strength is available.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: clincalPharmacology
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Description of the absorption and elimination of drugs, including their concentration (pharmacokinetics, pK) and biological effects (pharmacodynamics, pD).
Description of the absorption and elimination of drugs, including their concentration (pharmacokinetics, pK) and biological effects (pharmacodynamics, pD).
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: clinicalPharmacology

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: VitalSign
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Vital signs are measures of various physiological functions in order to assess the most basic body functions.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: LaboratoryScience
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A medical science pertaining to chemical, hematological, immunologic, microscopic, or bacteriological diagnostic analyses or research

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: maximumIntake
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: aspect
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: An aspect of medical practice that is considered on the page, such as 'diagnosis', 'treatment', 'causes', 'prognosis', 'etiology', 'epidemiology', etc.
The actual infectious agent, such as a specific bacterium.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: infectiousAgent

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Podiatric
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: Podiatry is the care of the human foot, especially the diagnosis and treatment of foot disorders.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A physical examination that can identify this sign.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: identifyingExam

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The value of the dose, e.g. 500.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: doseValue

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The stage of the condition, if applicable.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: stage
subStageSuffix
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The substage, e.g. 'a' for Stage IIIa.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: targetPopulation
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Characteristics of the population for which this is intended, or which typically uses it, e.g. 'adults'.
A preventative therapy used to prevent an initial occurrence of the medical condition, such as vaccination.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: primaryPrevention

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A sub property of instrument. The diet used in this action.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: exerciseRelatedDiet
availableTest
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A diagnostic test or procedure offered by this lab.

schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:label: Ayurvedic
schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:comment: A system of medicine that originated in India over thousands of years and that focuses on integrating and balancing the body, mind, and spirit.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: seriousAdverseOutcome
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A possible serious complication and/or serious side effect of this therapy. Serious adverse outcomes include those that are life-threatening; result in death, disability, or permanent damage; require hospitalization or prolong existing hospitalization; cause congenital anomalies or birth defects; or jeopardize the patient and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes in this definition.
The unit of the dose, e.g. 'mg'.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: doseUnit

schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:label: Eye
schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:comment: Eye or ophtalmological function assessment with clinical examination.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A medical service available from this provider.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: availableService

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A goal towards an action is taken. Can be concrete or abstract.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: purpose

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Imaging technique used.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: imagingTechnique

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the ear, nose and throat and their respective disease states.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Otolaryngologic

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: relatedCondition
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A medical condition associated with this anatomy.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: phase
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The phase of the clinical trial.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: ApprovedIndication
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An indication for a medical therapy that has been formally specified or approved by a regulatory body that regulates use of the therapy; for example, the US FDA approves indications for most drugs in the US.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: preparation
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Typical preparation that a patient must undergo before having the procedure performed.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: publicationType
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The type of the medical article, taken from the US NLM MeSH publication type catalog. See also MeSH documentation.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: TreatmentIndication
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An indication for treating an underlying condition, symptom, etc.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with poisons, their nature, effects and detection and involved in the treatment of poisoning.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Toxicologic

schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:comment: Any physical activity engaged in for recreational purposes. Examples may include ballroom dancing, roller skating, canoeing, fishing, etc.
schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:label: LeisureTimeActivity

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: costOrigin
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Additional details to capture the origin of the cost data. For example, 'Medicare Part B'.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: connectedTo
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Other anatomical structures to which this structure is connected.
A component test of the panel.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: subTest
repetitions
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Number of times one should repeat the activity.
Source of the data used to formulate the guidance, e.g. RCT, consensus opinion, etc.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: evidenceOrigin
interactingDrug
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Another drug that is known to interact with this drug in a way that impacts the effect of this drug or causes a risk to the patient. Note: disease interactions are typically captured as contraindications.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: studyLocation
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The location in which the study is taking/took place.

schema:MedicalProcedureType.rdfs:label: NoninvasiveProcedure
schema:MedicalProcedureType.rdfs:comment: A type of medical procedure that involves noninvasive techniques.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Nutritional information specific to the dietary plan. May include dietary recommendations on what foods to avoid, what foods to consume, and specific alterations/deviations from the USDA or other regulatory body's approved dietary guidelines.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: dietFeatures

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Link to prescribing information for the drug.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: prescribingInfo

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A condition the test is used to diagnose.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: usedToDiagnose

schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:comment: Genitourinary system function assessment with clinical examination.
schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:label: Genitourinary

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: intensity
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Quantitative measure gauging the degree of force involved in the exercise, for example, heartbeats per minute. May include the velocity of the movement.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalGuidelineContraindication
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A guideline contraindication that designates a process as harmful and where quality of the data supporting the contraindication is sound.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Optician
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A store that sells reading glasses and similar devices for improving vision.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A subject of the study, i.e. one of the medical conditions, therapies, devices, drugs, etc. investigated by the study.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: studySubject

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A factor that indicates use of this therapy for treatment and/or prevention of a condition, symptom, etc. For therapies such as drugs, indications can include both officially-approved indications as well as off-label uses. These can be distinguished by using the ApprovedIndication subtype of MedicalIndication.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: indication

schema:MedicalDevicePurpose.rdfs:label: Therapeutic
schema:MedicalDevicePurpose.rdfs:comment: A medical device used for therapeutic purposes.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Specific physiologic risks associated to the diet plan.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: risks
alcoholWarning
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to consumption of alcohol while taking this drug.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: cause
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Specifying a cause of something in general. e.g in medicine , one of the causative agent(s) that are most directly responsible for the pathophysiologic process that eventually results in the occurrence.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that deals with the evaluation and initial treatment of medical conditions caused by trauma or sudden illness.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Emergency

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: availableStrength
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: An available dosage strength for the drug.
How the disease spreads, either as a route or vector, for example 'direct contact', 'Aedes aegypti', etc.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: transmissionMethod

schema:MedicalProcedureType.rdfs:label: PercutaneousProcedure
schema:MedicalProcedureType.rdfs:comment: A type of medical procedure that involves percutaneous techniques, where access to organs or tissue is achieved via needle-puncture of the skin. For example, catheter-based procedures like stent delivery.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of diseases, debilities and provision of care to the aged.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Geriatric

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of heart and vasculature.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Cardiovascular
Musculoskeletal
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of muscles, ligaments and skeletal system.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Device used to perform the test.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: usesDevice

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Urologic
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of diseases pertaining to the urinary tract and the urogenital system.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: partOfSystem
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The anatomical or organ system that this structure is part of.
A therapy that duplicates or overlaps this one.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: duplicateTherapy

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: The science or practice of testing visual acuity and prescribing corrective lenses.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Optometric

schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:label: TripleBlindedTrial
schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:comment: A trial design in which neither the researcher, the person administering the therapy nor the patient knows the details of the treatment the patient was randomly assigned to.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: medicineSystem
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The system of medicine that includes this MedicalEntity, for example 'evidence-based', 'homeopathic', 'chiropractic', etc.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of digestive system.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Gastroenterologic
Infectious
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: Something in medical science that pertains to infectious diseases i.e caused by bacterial, viral, fungal or parasitic infections.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A possible unexpected and unfavorable evolution of a medical condition. Complications may include worsening of the signs or symptoms of the disease, extension of the condition to other organ systems, etc.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: possibleComplication
preOp
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A description of the workup, testing, and other preparations required before implanting this device.

schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:label: MulticellularParasite
schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:comment: Multicellular parasite that causes an infection.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: supplyTo
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The area to which the artery supplies blood.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: administrationRoute
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A route by which this drug may be administered, e.g. 'oral'.
A medical guideline related to this entity.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: guideline

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: The practice or art and science of preparing and dispensing drugs and medicines.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: PharmacySpecialty

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: warning
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any FDA or other warnings about the drug (text or URL).

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: activityFrequency
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: How often one should engage in the activity.
A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology such as ICD-9, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm, etc.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: code

schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:label: Balance
schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:comment: Physical activity that is engaged to help maintain posture and balance.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: followup
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Typical or recommended followup care after the procedure is performed.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that deals with benign and malignant tumors, including the study of their development, diagnosis, treatment and prevention.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Oncologic

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DiagnosticProcedure
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A medical procedure intended primarily for diagnostic, as opposed to therapeutic, purposes.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: costPerUnit
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The cost per unit of the drug.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: arterialBranch
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The branches that comprise the arterial structure.
The branches that delineate from the nerve bundle. Not to be confused with branchOf.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: branch

schema:MedicalProcedureType.rdfs:label: SurgicalProcedure
schema:MedicalProcedureType.rdfs:comment: A type of medical procedure that involves invasive surgical techniques.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: muscleAction
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The movement the muscle generates.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: diagram
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: An image containing a diagram that illustrates the structure and/or its component substructures and/or connections with other structures.
Link to the drug's label details.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: labelDetails

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A process of care relying upon counseling, dialogue and communication aimed at improving a mental health condition without use of drugs.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: PsychologicalTreatment

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The unit in which the drug is measured, e.g. '5 mg tablet'.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: drugUnit
runsTo
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The vasculature the lymphatic structure runs, or efferents, to.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: activityDuration
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Length of time to engage in the activity.

schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:label: FDAcategoryA
schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:comment: A designation by the US FDA signifying that adequate and well-controlled studies have failed to demonstrate a risk to the fetus in the first trimester of pregnancy (and there is no evidence of risk in later trimesters).

schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:label: Bacteria
schema:InfectiousAgentClass.rdfs:comment: Pathogenic bacteria that cause bacterial infection.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The degree of mobility the joint allows.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: functionalClass

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The anatomical or organ system that the artery originates from.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: source
nerve
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The underlying innervation associated with the muscle.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalRiskCalculator
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A complex mathematical calculation requiring an online calculator, used to assess prognosis. Note: use the url property of Thing to record any URLs for online calculators.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: comprisedOf
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Specifying something physically contained by something else. Typically used here for the underlying anatomical structures, such as organs, that comprise the anatomical system.

schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:label: Longitudinal
schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:comment: Unlike cross-sectional studies, longitudinal studies track the same people, and therefore the differences observed in those people are less likely to be the result of cultural differences across generations. Longitudinal studies are also used in medicine to uncover predictors of certain diseases.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the study of the respiratory system and its respective disease states.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Pulmonary

schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:label: Lung
schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:comment: Lung and respiratory system clinical examination.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to therapeutic or cosmetic repair or re-formation of missing, injured or malformed tissues or body parts by manual and instrumental means.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: PlasticSurgery
Nursing
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A health profession of a person formally educated and trained in the care of the sick or infirm person.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Physiotherapy
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: The practice of treatment of disease, injury, or deformity by physical methods such as massage, heat treatment, and exercise rather than by drugs or surgery..

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A sub property of instrument. The exercise plan used on this action.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: exercisePlan

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: CommunityHealth
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A field of public health focusing on improving health characteristics of a defined population in relation with their geographical or environment areas

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: stageAsNumber
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The stage represented as a number, e.g. 3.

schema:DrugCostCategory.rdfs:comment: The drug's cost represents the retail cost of the drug.
schema:DrugCostCategory.rdfs:label: Retail

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: If applicable, a medical specialty in which this entity is relevant.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: relevantSpecialty
diet
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A sub property of instrument. The diet used in this action.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: procedureType
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The type of procedure, for example Surgical, Noninvasive, or Percutaneous.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: signOrSymptom
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A sign or symptom of this condition. Signs are objective or physically observable manifestations of the medical condition while symptoms are the subjective experience of the medical condition.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: signDetected
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A sign detected by the test.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to hereditary transmission and the variation of inherited characteristics and disorders.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Genetic

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the study, treatment, and prevention of mental illness, using both medical and psychological therapies.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Psychiatric

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: status
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The status of the study (enumerated).

schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:comment: A system of medicine focused on promoting the body's innate ability to heal itself.
schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:label: Osteopathic

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: workload
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Quantitative measure of the physiologic output of the exercise; also referred to as energy expenditure.
Any other drug related to this one, for example commonly-prescribed alternatives.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: relatedDrug
riskFactor
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A modifiable or non-modifiable factor that increases the risk of a patient contracting this condition, e.g. age, coexisting condition.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Dentistry
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A branch of medicine that is involved in the dental care.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Endocrine
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of endocrine glands and their secretions.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The units of an active ingredient's strength, e.g. mg.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: strengthUnit

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: One of a set of differential diagnoses for the condition. Specifically, a closely-related or competing diagnosis typically considered later in the cognitive process whereby this medical condition is distinguished from others most likely responsible for a similar collection of signs and symptoms to reach the most parsimonious diagnosis or diagnoses in a patient.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: differentialDiagnosis

schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:label: Flexibility
schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:comment: Physical activity that is engaged in to improve joint and muscle flexibility.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: pregnancyCategory
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Pregnancy category of this drug.

schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:label: AerobicActivity
schema:PhysicalActivityCategory.rdfs:comment: Physical activity of relatively low intensity that depends primarily on the aerobic energy-generating process; during activity, the aerobic metabolism uses oxygen to adequately meet energy demands during exercise.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Obsolete term for muscleAction. Not to be confused with potentialAction.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: action

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Surgical
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to treating diseases, injuries and deformities by manual and instrumental means.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A description of the procedure involved in setting up, using, and/or installing the device.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: procedure
doseSchedule
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A dosing schedule for the drug for a given population, either observed, recommended, or maximum dose based on the type used.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: tributary
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The anatomical or organ system that the vein flows into; a larger structure that the vein connects to.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: healthCondition
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Specifying the health condition(s) of a patient, medical study, or other target audience.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any complaint sensed and expressed by the patient (therefore defined as subjective) like stomachache, lower-back pain, or fatigue.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalSymptom

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: Branch of medicine that pertains to the health services to improve and protect community health, especially epidemiology, sanitation, immunization, and preventive medicine.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: PublicHealth

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: recommendedIntake

schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:comment: A designation that the drug in question has not been assigned a pregnancy category designation by the US FDA.
schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:label: FDAnotEvaluated

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: costCategory
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The category of cost, such as wholesale, retail, reimbursement cap, etc.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: PhysicalTherapy
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A process of progressive physical care and rehabilitation aimed at improving a health condition.

schema:DrugPrescriptionStatus.rdfs:comment: The character of a medical substance, typically a medicine, of being available over the counter or not.
schema:DrugPrescriptionStatus.rdfs:label: OTC

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Proprietary name given to the diet plan, typically by its originator or creator.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: proprietaryName

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The anatomical or organ system drained by this vessel; generally refers to a specific part of an organ.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: regionDrained

schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:comment: The conventional Western system of medicine, that aims to apply the best available evidence gained from the scientific method to clinical decision making. Also known as conventional or Western medicine.
schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:label: WesternConventional

schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:label: CrossSectional
schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:comment: Studies carried out on pre-existing data (usually from 'snapshot' surveys), such as that collected by the Census Bureau. Sometimes called Prevalence Studies.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: recognizingAuthority
antagonist
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The muscle whose action counteracts the specified muscle.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: expectedPrognosis
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The likely outcome in either the short term or long term of the medical condition.
The type of tissue sample required for the test.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: tissueSample
strengthValue
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The value of an active ingredient's strength, e.g. 325.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: frequency
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: How often the dose is taken, e.g. 'daily'.

schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:comment: Also known as a panel study. A cohort study is a form of longitudinal study used in medicine and social science. It is one type of study design and should be compared with a cross-sectional study. A cohort is a group of people who share a common characteristic or experience within a defined period (e.g., are born, leave school, lose their job, are exposed to a drug or a vaccine, etc.). The comparison group may be the general population from which the cohort is drawn, or it may be another cohort of persons thought to have had little or no exposure to the substance under investigation, but otherwise similar. Alternatively, subgroups within the cohort may be compared with each other.
schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:label: CohortStudy

schema:MedicalEvidenceLevel.rdfs:label: EvidenceLevelA
schema:MedicalEvidenceLevel.rdfs:comment: Data derived from multiple randomized clinical trials or meta-analyses.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any information related to overdose on a drug, including signs or symptoms, treatments, contact information for emergency response.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: overdosage
causeOf
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The condition, complication, symptom, sign, etc. caused.
Function of the anatomical structure.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: function

schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:label: TraditionalChinese
schema:MedicineSystem.rdfs:comment: A system of medicine based on common theoretical concepts that originated in China and evolved over thousands of years, that uses herbs, acupuncture, exercise, massage, dietary therapy, and other methods to treat a wide range of conditions.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: medicalSpecialty
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A medical specialty of the provider.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: normalRange
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Range of acceptable values for a typical patient, when applicable.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: subStructure
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Component (sub-)structure(s) that comprise this anatomical structure.

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Obstetric
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that specializes in the care of women during the prenatal and postnatal care and with the delivery of the child.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: additionalVariable
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any additional component of the exercise prescription that may need to be articulated to the patient. This may include the order of exercises, the number of repetitions of movement, quantitative distance, progressions over time, etc.
Specifics about the trial design (enumerated).
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: trialDesign

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Medical expert advice related to the plan.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: expertConsiderations

schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:comment: Nose function assessment with clinical examination.
schema:PhysicalExam.rdfs:label: Nose

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The vasculature the lymphatic structure originates, or afferents, from.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: originatesFrom

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of blood and blood producing organs.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Hematologic

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to the muscle.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: bloodSupply

schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:comment: Radiography is an imaging technique that uses electromagnetic radiation other than visible light, especially X-rays, to view the internal structure of a non-uniformly composed and opaque object such as the human body.
schema:MedicalSpecialty.rdfs:label: Radiography

schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:label: OpenTrial
schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:comment: A trial design in which the researcher knows the full details of the treatment, and so does the patient.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A modifiable or non-modifiable risk factor included in the calculation, e.g. age, coexisting condition.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: includedRiskFactor
safetyConsideration
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: Any potential safety concern associated with the supplement. May include interactions with other drugs and foods, pregnancy, breastfeeding, known adverse reactions, and documented efficacy of the supplement.

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: possibleTreatment
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A possible treatment to address this condition, sign or symptom.

schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:label: FDAcategoryB
schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:comment: A designation by the US FDA signifying that animal reproduction studies have failed to demonstrate a risk to the fetus and there are no adequate and well-controlled studies in pregnant women.

schema:MedicalEvidenceLevel.rdfs:label: EvidenceLevelC
schema:MedicalEvidenceLevel.rdfs:comment: Only consensus opinion of experts, case studies, or standard-of-care.

schema:MedicalAudience.rdfs:comment: Medical clinicians, including practicing physicians and other medical professionals involved in clinical practice.
schema:MedicalAudience.rdfs:label: Clinician

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: drugClass
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The class of drug this belongs to (e.g., statins).

schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:label: FDAcategoryX
schema:DrugPregnancyCategory.rdfs:comment: A designation by the US FDA signifying that studies in animals or humans have demonstrated fetal abnormalities and/or there is positive evidence of human fetal risk based on adverse reaction data from investigational or marketing experience, and the risks involved in use of the drug in pregnant women clearly outweigh potential benefits.

rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: A more specific type of the condition, where applicable, for example 'Type 1 Diabetes', 'Type 2 Diabetes', or 'Gestational Diabetes' for Diabetes.
rdf:Property.rdfs:label: subtype

schema:MedicalEvidenceLevel.rdfs:label: EvidenceLevelB
schema:MedicalEvidenceLevel.rdfs:comment: Data derived from a single randomized trial, or nonrandomized studies.

schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:comment: A trial that takes place at multiple centers.
schema:MedicalTrialDesign.rdfs:label: MultiCenterTrial

rdf:Property.rdfs:label: significance
rdf:Property.rdfs:comment: The significance associated with the superficial anatomy; as an example, how characteristics of the superficial anatomy can suggest underlying medical conditions or courses of treatment.

schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:comment: A case series (also known as a clinical series) is a medical research study that tracks patients with a known exposure given similar treatment or examines their medical records for exposure and outcome. A case series can be retrospective or prospective and usually involves a smaller number of patients than the more powerful case-control studies or randomized controlled trials. Case series may be consecutive or non-consecutive, depending on whether all cases presenting to the reporting authors over a period of time were included, or only a selection.
schema:MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.rdfs:label: CaseSeries

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A short band of tough, flexible, fibrous connective tissue that functions to connect multiple bones, cartilages, and structurally support joints.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Ligament

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Anatomical features that can be observed by sight (without dissection), including the form and proportions of the human body as well as surface landmarks that correspond to deeper subcutaneous structures. Superficial anatomy plays an important role in sports medicine, phlebotomy, and other medical specialties as underlying anatomical structures can be identified through surface palpation. For example, during back surgery, superficial anatomy can be used to palpate and count vertebrae to find the site of incision. Or in phlebotomy, superficial anatomy can be used to locate an underlying vein; for example, the median cubital vein can be located by palpating the borders of the cubital fossa (such as the epicondyles of the humerus) and then looking for the superficial signs of the vein, such as size, prominence, ability to refill after depression, and feel of surrounding tissue support. As another example, in a subluxation (dislocation) of the glenohumeral joint, the bony structure becomes pronounced with the deltoid muscle failing to cover the glenohumeral joint allowing the edges of the scapula to be superficially visible. Here, the superficial anatomy is the visible edges of the scapula, implying the underlying dislocation of the joint (the related anatomical structure).
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: SuperficialAnatomy

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A specific dosing schedule for a drug or supplement.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DoseSchedule
AnatomicalSystem
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An anatomical system is a group of anatomical structures that work together to perform a certain task. Anatomical systems, such as organ systems, are one organizing principle of anatomy, and can includes circulatory, digestive, endocrine, integumentary, immune, lymphatic, muscular, nervous, reproductive, respiratory, skeletal, urinary, vestibular, and other systems.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: ImagingTest
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes.
Any part of the human body, typically a component of an anatomical system. Organs, tissues, and cells are all anatomical structures.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: AnatomicalStructure

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Substance
DrugPregnancyCategory
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Categories that represent an assessment of the risk of fetal injury due to a drug or pharmaceutical used as directed by the mother during pregnancy.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DiagnosticLab
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A medical laboratory that offers on-site or off-site diagnostic services.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalSignOrSymptom
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any feature associated or not with a medical condition. In medicine a symptom is generally subjective while a sign is objective.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalRiskFactor
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A risk factor is anything that increases a person's likelihood of developing or contracting a disease, medical condition, or complication.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Vessel
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A component of the human body circulatory system comprised of an intricate network of hollow tubes that transport blood throughout the entire body.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalTest
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any medical test, typically performed for diagnostic purposes.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalEntity
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The most generic type of entity related to health and the practice of medicine.
Target audiences for medical web pages. Enumerated type.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalAudience

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A web page that provides medical information.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalWebPage

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries blood away from the heart.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Artery
MaximumDoseSchedule
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The maximum dosing schedule considered safe for a drug or supplement as recommended by an authority or by the drug/supplement's manufacturer. Capture the recommending authority in the recognizingAuthority property of MedicalEntity.

A chemical or biologic substance, used as a medical therapy, that has a physiological effect on an organism. Here the term drug is used interchangeably with the term medicine although clinical knowledge make a clear difference between them.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Drug
DrugLegalStatus
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The legal availability status of a medical drug.

Any bodily activity that enhances or maintains physical fitness and overall health and wellness. Includes activity that is part of daily living and routine, structured exercise, and exercise prescribed as part of a medical treatment or recovery plan.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: PhysicalActivity
MedicalImagingTechnique
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes. Enumerated type.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DrugClass
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A class of medical drugs, e.g., statins. Classes can represent general pharmacological class, common mechanisms of action, common physiological effects, etc.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalIntangible
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things in the medical space.
Any anatomical structure which pertains to the soft nervous tissue functioning as the coordinating center of sensation and intellectual and nervous activity.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: BrainStructure

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether this drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DrugPrescriptionStatus
DDxElement
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An alternative, closely-related condition typically considered later in the differential diagnosis process along with the signs that are used to distinguish it.

Enumerations related to health and the practice of medicine: A concept that is used to attribute a quality to another concept, as a qualifier, a collection of items or a listing of all of the elements of a set in medicine practice.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalEnumeration
MedicalStudyStatus
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The status of a medical study. Enumerated type.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalRiskScore
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A simple system that adds up the number of risk factors to yield a score that is associated with prognosis, e.g. CHAD score, TIMI risk score.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Muscle
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A muscle is an anatomical structure consisting of a contractile form of tissue that animals use to effect movement.
Design models for medical trials. Enumerated type.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalTrialDesign
MedicalTrial
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A medical trial is a type of medical study that uses scientific process used to compare the safety and efficacy of medical therapies or medical procedures. In general, medical trials are controlled and subjects are allocated at random to the different treatment and/or control groups.
A particular physical or virtual business of an organization for medical purposes. Examples of MedicalBusiness include differents business run by health professionals.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalBusiness

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The causative agent(s) that are responsible for the pathophysiologic process that eventually results in a medical condition, symptom or sign. In this schema, unless otherwise specified this is meant to be the proximate cause of the medical condition, symptom or sign. The proximate cause is defined as the causative agent that most directly results in the medical condition, symptom or sign. For example, the HIV virus could be considered a cause of AIDS. Or in a diagnostic context, if a patient fell and sustained a hip fracture and two days later sustained a pulmonary embolism which eventuated in a cardiac arrest, the cause of the cardiac arrest (the proximate cause) would be the pulmonary embolism and not the fall. Medical causes can include cardiovascular, chemical, dermatologic, endocrine, environmental, gastroenterologic, genetic, hematologic, gynecologic, iatrogenic, infectious, musculoskeletal, neurologic, nutritional, obstetric, oncologic, otolaryngologic, pharmacologic, psychiatric, pulmonary, renal, rheumatologic, toxic, traumatic, or urologic causes; medical conditions can be causes as well.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalCause

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A process of care involving exercise, changes to diet, fitness routines, and other lifestyle changes aimed at improving a health condition.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: LifestyleModification

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any medical intervention designed to prevent, treat, and cure human diseases and medical conditions, including both curative and palliative therapies. Medical therapies are typically processes of care relying upon pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, supportive therapy (with fluid or nutrition for example), or detoxification (e.g. hemodialysis) aimed at improving or preventing a health condition.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalTherapy
Patient
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A patient is any person recipient of health care services.

A recommended dosing schedule for a drug or supplement as prescribed or recommended by an authority or by the drug/supplement's manufacturer. Capture the recommending authority in the recognizingAuthority property of MedicalEntity.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: RecommendedDoseSchedule

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A specific strength in which a medical drug is available in a specific country.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DrugStrength

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A facility, often associated with a hospital or medical school, that is devoted to the specific diagnosis and/or healthcare. Previously limited to outpatients but with evolution it may be open to inpatients as well.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalClinic
DietarySupplement
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A product taken by mouth that contains a dietary ingredient intended to supplement the diet. Dietary ingredients may include vitamins, minerals, herbs or other botanicals, amino acids, and substances such as enzymes, organ tissues, glandulars and metabolites.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Vein
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries blood to the heart.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: InfectiousAgentClass
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Classes of agents or pathogens that transmit infectious diseases. Enumerated type.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalGuideline
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any recommendation made by a standard society (e.g. ACC/AHA) or consensus statement that denotes how to diagnose and treat a particular condition. Note: this type should be used to tag the actual guideline recommendation; if the guideline recommendation occurs in a larger scholarly article, use MedicalScholarlyArticle to tag the overall article, not this type. Note also: the organization making the recommendation should be captured in the recognizingAuthority base property of MedicalEntity.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalSign
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any physical manifestation of a person's medical condition discoverable by objective diagnostic tests or physical examination.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalRiskEstimator
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any rule set or interactive tool for estimating the risk of developing a complication or condition.
A stage of a medical condition, such as 'Stage IIIa'.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalConditionStage

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A type of physical examination of a patient performed by a physician.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: PhysicalExam

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A condition or factor that indicates use of a medical therapy, including signs, symptoms, risk factors, anatomical states, etc.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalIndication
MedicalTestPanel
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any collection of tests commonly ordered together.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: TherapeuticProcedure
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A medical procedure intended primarily for therapeutic purposes, aimed at improving a health condition.
Any condition of the human body that affects the normal functioning of a person, whether physically or mentally. Includes diseases, injuries, disabilities, disorders, syndromes, etc.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalCondition
Diet
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A strategy of regulating the intake of food to achieve or maintain a specific health-related goal.
A medical test performed by a laboratory that typically involves examination of a tissue sample by a pathologist.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: PathologyTest
Nerve
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A common pathway for the electrochemical nerve impulses that are transmitted along each of the axons.
A code for a medical entity.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalCode
MedicalContraindication
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A condition or factor that serves as a reason to withhold a certain medical therapy. Contraindications can be absolute (there are no reasonable circumstances for undertaking a course of action) or relative (the patient is at higher risk of complications, but that these risks may be outweighed by other considerations or mitigated by other measures).

The cost per unit of a medical drug. Note that this type is not meant to represent the price in an offer of a drug for sale; see the Offer type for that. This type will typically be used to tag wholesale or average retail cost of a drug, or maximum reimbursable cost. Costs of medical drugs vary widely depending on how and where they are paid for, so while this type captures some of the variables, costs should be used with caution by consumers of this schema's markup.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DrugCost

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Any specific branch of medical science or practice. Medical specialities include clinical specialties that pertain to particular organ systems and their respective disease states, as well as allied health specialties. Enumerated type.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalSpecialty
MedicalProcedureType
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An enumeration that describes different types of medical procedures.
Any object used in a medical capacity, such as to diagnose or treat a patient.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalDevice

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The anatomical location at which two or more bones make contact.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Joint

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Systems of medical practice.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicineSystem
MedicalScholarlyArticle
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A scholarly article in the medical domain.
Level of evidence for a medical guideline. Enumerated type.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalEvidenceLevel
MedicalGuidelineRecommendation
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A guideline recommendation that is regarded as efficacious and where quality of the data supporting the recommendation is sound.
Fitness-related activity designed for a specific health-related purpose, including defined exercise routines as well as activity prescribed by a clinician.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: ExercisePlan
MedicalStudy
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A medical study is an umbrella type covering all kinds of research studies relating to human medicine or health, including observational studies and interventional trials and registries, randomized, controlled or not. When the specific type of study is known, use one of the extensions of this type, such as MedicalTrial or MedicalObservationalStudy. Also, note that this type should be used to mark up data that describes the study itself; to tag an article that publishes the results of a study, use MedicalScholarlyArticle. Note: use the code property of MedicalEntity to store study IDs, e.g. clinicaltrials.gov ID.
Enumerated categories of medical drug costs.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: DrugCostCategory
MedicalObservationalStudy
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An observational study is a type of medical study that attempts to infer the possible effect of a treatment through observation of a cohort of subjects over a period of time. In an observational study, the assignment of subjects into treatment groups versus control groups is outside the control of the investigator. This is in contrast with controlled studies, such as the randomized controlled trials represented by MedicalTrial, where each subject is randomly assigned to a treatment group or a control group before the start of the treatment.
Categories of medical devices, organized by the purpose or intended use of the device.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalDevicePurpose

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalProcedure
LymphaticVessel
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries lymph fluid unidirectionally toward the heart.

An infectious disease is a clinically evident human disease resulting from the presence of pathogenic microbial agents, like pathogenic viruses, pathogenic bacteria, fungi, protozoa, multicellular parasites, and prions. To be considered an infectious disease, such pathogens are known to be able to cause this disease.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: InfectiousDisease

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Design models for observational medical studies. Enumerated type.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: MedicalObservationalStudyDesign
PhysicalActivityCategory
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Categories of physical activity, organized by physiologic classification.
